conclusion: Analyze the velocity-time graphs of two objects, A and B, moving in the same direction along a straight line.
The graph for object A shows a peak velocity at t1, while the graph for object B shows a peak velocity at t1.
Determine the difference in speed between the two objects at any given time t by the difference in their positions on the velocity axis at t.
Since both objects reach their peak velocity at t1, the difference in speed between them is constant at this point.
Since the difference in speed is constant and does not increase from 0 to t1, the statement that the difference in speed between the two objects is continuously increasing is incorrect.
Conclude that the difference in speed between the two objects is not continuously increasing.
